a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards
indicators. The intensity is the share of indicators in which people in multidimensional poverty are deprived on
Data source: Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2024) - The Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) 2024
Note: This data aims to provide estimates that are comparable over time within individual countries. A separate dataset provides more
complete data of the latest estimates for international comparisons.
